snippet: Waits are hours long for “Rain Room,” an installation at the Museum of Modern Art that has rain falling all around, but miraculously, not on you.
abstract: Waiting time is hours long to experience Rain Room, temporary installation at Museum of Modern Art in which water rains down except where sensors detect people; exhibit, which gives visitors illusion of walking between drops, allows 10 people at a time, though many ignore museum's request to limit visits to 10 minutes; installation receives tepid reviews but is drawing tens of thousands of visitors.
lead_paragraph: Waits are hours long for “Rain Room,” an installation at the Museum of Modern Art that has rain falling all around, but miraculously, not on you.

headline.main: Steamy Wait Before a Walk in a Museum’s Rain
headline.print_headline: Steamy Wait Before a Walk in a Museum’s Rain
